attributes.background: Talk about scrapping the idea of 15 minute cities in the UK

rejection.details:
Decisions about local roads are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

Cities that are looking to implement a 15-minute city policy aim to have all necessary amenities in a 15-minute radius and do not include plans to restrict freedom of movement.

If you are concerned about proposals regarding local roads in your area you could raise this with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
